Class PersonService

java.lang.Object
com.prototype.services.PersonService
public class PersonService extends Object
Service class that handles business logic related to Person entities.

This class acts as an intermediary between the presentation layer and the data access layer, performing validations and ensuring data integrity before interacting with PersonDAO.

  • Constructor Details

    • PersonService

      public PersonService()
      Creates a new instance of PersonService. Initializes the internal PersonDAO.

  • Method Details

    • findAll

      public List<Person> findAll()
      Retrieves all registered persons.
      Returns:
      a list of all Person entities.

    • createPerson

      public Person createPerson(String fullName, String document, Role role)
      Creates and saves a new Person in the system.

      Performs validation for required fields before persisting.

      Parameters:
      fullName - the full name of the person; must not be blank.
      document - the identification document; must not be blank.
      role - the role assigned to the person; must not be null.
      Returns:
      the created Person instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any validation fails.

    • findById

      public Person findById(Long id)
      Finds a Person by its unique ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the identifier of the person; must not be null.
      Returns:
      the found Person.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the ID is null.
      javax.persistence.EntityNotFoundException - if no person is found with the given ID.

    • updatePerson

      public Person updatePerson(Long id, String newFullName, String newDocument, Role newRole)
      Updates an existing Person's information.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the person to update; must not be null.
      newFullName - new full name; must not be blank.
      newDocument - new identification document; must not be blank.
      newRole - new role; must not be null.
      Returns:
      the updated Person.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any validation fails.
      javax.persistence.EntityNotFoundException - if the person does not exist.

    • deletePerson

      public void deletePerson(Long id)
      Deletes a Person by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the person to delete; must not be null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the ID is null.
      javax.persistence.EntityNotFoundException - if no person exists with the given ID.
